result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmy D Davis Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jimmy D Davis Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Jimmy D Davis Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Richard Westphal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court is in trial on another matter.  Court set a status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion to Join

Defendant Jimmy D Davis Jr appeared by phone.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Jimmy D Davis Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Received and Filed:  Notice of Retainer and Motion for Leave to File Appearance on Behalf of Defendant

Adjustment Number: 22A 085334,
Payable Number: 1030562,
Receipt Number: 22RP035913,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Jimmy D Davis in court by video.  Nicolas Heitman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.   
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Due to failure to be booked and released in a timely matter there is an active bench warrant in this matter. Court will cancel the warrant.  Mr Davis has until 3PM 8/4/2022 to be booked and released. If he fails to do so the warrant will be issued again. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Jimmy D Davis not in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failed to appear to be booked and released.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07-17-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Defendant is PROHIBITED from taking or transporting a human body alive or dead. Defendant is PROHIBITED from performing or communicating any work that involves dead human bodies.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sheldon, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Defendant Jimmy D Davis in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jimmy D Davis Jr
Current: 4803 W. Burleigh St., Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 06-30-2022)
Prior: 8922 West Winfield Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53225
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Jimmy D Davis not in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/14/22 @ 1p
